conclusion: Velocity is inversely proportional to displacement, expressed as v = k/x.
Using velocity at point B (2 m/s) and displacement (2 m) to find constant k = 4.
Using velocity at point A (4 m/s) to find displacement x_A = 1 m.
Setting up integral to find time from point A to B: t = ∫(1 to 2) (x/4) dx.
Calculating integral: t = (1/4) ∫(1 to 2) x dx = (1/4) [x^2/2] from 1 to 2.
Final answer: Time from point A to B is 3/8 s.
